intro: Hieracium sinaicum, commonly known as the Sinai hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. It features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, with yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Hieracium sinaicum is often found in mountainous regions and is an important part of the local flora in its native habitat.
